thread.section_title: Manchester United legend Roy Keane rips into Arsenal flops after Bayern Munich defeat – Metro
thread.title: Manchester United legend Roy Keane rips into Arsenal flops after Bayern Munich defeat
thread.title_full: Manchester United legend Roy Keane rips into Arsenal flops after Bayern Munich defeat

author: louissealey1
title: Manchester United legend Roy Keane rips into Arsenal flops after Bayern Munich defeat
text:
Arsenal suffered a 5-1 defeat against Bayern Munich (Picture: Getty) Roy Keane insists Arsenal are desperately short of leaders after suffering a humbling defeat at Bayern Munich in the Champions League.
Arsene Wenger’s side held their own for 45 minutes at the Allianz Arena but eventually succumbed to a devastating 5-1 loss as Bayern took full control of the tie.
Bayern Munich 5-1 Arsenal player ratings: Ozil & Iwobi go missing as Gunners crumble again The Gunners began to fall apart after captain Laurent Koscielny hobbled off with an injury, handing the armband over to Kieran Gibbs.
Keane, who won seven Premier League titles with United as a player, believes Gibbs being given the captaincy is symptomatic of the problems Arsenal face.
‘You need to be organised at the back. When you’re 2 or 3-1 down, you need to take your medicine and stay in the game,’ the Manchester United legend told ITV Football.
‘When I see Gibbs with the armband on at the end of the game, you’re in big trouble.
Keane on lack of leaders at Arsenal "When I see Gibbs with the armband on at the end of the game, you're in trouble" https://t.co/rtHLMtAFpP 
— ITV Football (@itvfootball) February 15, 2017 
More: Football Picture: Alexis Sanchez's stunning reaction to Bayern Munich's fifth goal against Arsenal 
Worried, Jose? President of top club admits he would LOVE to sign Man Utd star 
Bayern Munich brutally troll Arsenal minutes after emphatic 5-1 win 
‘If he’s your captain, your leader, the guy who’s going to bring everyone together, you’re in huge trouble.
‘Bayern weren’t at their best – they didn’t have to be – because the goals Arsenal gave away were schoolboy stuff.’
MORE: Bayern Munich brutally trolled Arsenal just minutes after emphatic 5-1 Champions League win
